medical_history.chief_complaint: Ventricular tachycardia and QT interval prolongation secondary to voriconazole treatment.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient's symptoms began 22 days after starting voriconazole treatment and included bradycardia (heart rate, 28 beats per minute) and QT interval prolongation noted on electrocardiography. The bradycardia and QT prolongation recurred after a rechallenge with voriconazole.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient has a history of acute lymphoblastic leukemia diagnosed 22 months earlier, with a recent bone marrow relapse and a known Fusarium infection. No previous cardiac problems were indicated.
medical_history.family_history: No family history of cardiac arrhythmia or sudden deaths.
